meanings.definition: Able to be communicated or transmitted
meanings.sent1: The teacher explained that the information was communicable to all students.
meanings.sent2: The virus is communicable through close contact with an infected person.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a surprise party was so communicable that everyone found out before the event.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project was so communicable, it spread to the entire team.
meanings.sent5: The joy in her voice was so communicable that it lifted everyone's spirits.

meanings.definition: Capable of being spread or passed on to others
meanings.sent1: The flu is a communicable disease that can easily pass from one person to another.
meanings.sent2: Gossip is a communicable behavior that can quickly spread among friends.
meanings.sent3: The laughter in the room was so communicable that soon everyone was smiling.
meanings.sent4: His positive attitude was as communicable as a yawn in a crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the air was so communicable that even strangers joined in the celebration.
